architectural_decisions.title: Use of Microservices Architecture
architectural_decisions.rationale: To ensure scalability, maintainability, and security in the e-commerce system.

architectural_decisions.title: Employing Repository Pattern
architectural_decisions.rationale: Abstraction of data access layer for better separation of concerns and easier maintenance.

architectural_decisions.title: Dependency Injection via FastAPI
architectural_decisions.rationale: To manage dependencies efficiently and enhance testability.

architectural_decisions.title: Custom Error Handling with HTTPException
architectural_decisions.rationale: To provide clear and consistent error responses for various scenarios.

architectural_decisions.title: Support for Multiple Payment Providers
architectural_decisions.rationale: To offer flexibility and choice for customers during checkout.

architectural_decisions.title: JWT Token-based Authentication
architectural_decisions.rationale: For secure and stateless authentication in the microservices environment.

architectural_decisions.title: Authorization Enforcement at Endpoints
architectural_decisions.rationale: To ensure that only authorized users can perform specific actions on their orders.

architectural_decisions.title: ORM for Database Interactions
architectural_decisions.rationale: To simplify database operations and improve code readability.

architectural_decisions.title: Confirmation Emails via send_order_confirmation Function
architectural_decisions.rationale: To notify customers about successful order creation and enhance user experience.

components.name: orders
components.description: REST API endpoints for order management, including create, get, list, and cancel operations.

components.name: processor
components.description: Placeholder for payment processing logic, supports multiple payment providers and transaction management.

Create a New Order.description: Allows users to create a new order by providing order items, shipping address, and payment method.

steps.description: Send a POST request to '/api/orders/create' with the required order data in the request body.
Validate the response to ensure successful creation of the order.

Get Order Details.description: Retrieves the details of a specific order by its ID.

steps.description: Send a GET request to '/api/orders/{order_id}' with the order ID as a path parameter.
Validate the response to ensure successful retrieval of the order details.

List User Orders.description: Lists all orders for the current user, supporting pagination via limit and offset parameters.

steps.description: Send a GET request to '/api/orders/' with optional query parameters for limit and offset.
Validate the response to ensure successful listing of orders.

Cancel an Order.description: Allows users to cancel a pending order.

steps.description: Send a POST request to '/api/orders/{order_id}/cancel' with the order ID as a path parameter.
Validate the response to ensure successful cancellation of the order.
